title: New Zealand Business 2-Year Inflation Expectations
description: Inflation Expectations in New Zealand increased to 3.60 percent in the fourth quarter of 2022 from 3.10 percent in the third quarter of 2022. Inflation Expectations in New Zealand averaged 2.52 percent from 1987 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 8.30 percent in the third quarter of 1987 and a record low of 1.24 percent in the second quarter of 2020. In New Zealand, business inflation expectations refer to two-year inflation forecast. Two years is seen as the timeframe when any central bank monetary policy action will filter through to prices. This page provides - New Zealand Business Inflation Expectations- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Reserve Bank of New Zealand
